page.title: 08NORTH HUISH GEOGRAPHY
page.content: Nestling tranquilly, hidden in the folds of undulating Devonshire Countryside, gently guarded by the towering Moors,North Huish is a small. scattered village, picturesquely sited on the Western acclivities of the{AVON {VALLEY.} The survey area comprises mostly Grade 3 agricultural land used for dairying, livestock rearing and arable. The pattern of the land is drawn by typical Devon banks and hedgerow trees. The bare boundaries are cut by flail machines. The{Combes slope down to small streams which enter the Avon, or in the case of Ugborough, the {Erme.}The western part of the area lies in the Parish of Ugborough, the eastern part in North Huish, administered by the Rector of Diptford, adjoining the sector.
